Issues.Title: test(compiler-cli): refactor the compliance tests to enable partial g‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶olden file checks

The compliance tests check that the output of the AOT compiler generates
valid code. This commit changes the way these work so that the inputs and
expectations are stored in files, rather than inline strings.

This enables new golden file checks for the partial compilation of
components and directives.

Issues.Title: ElementInjector hierarchy fails to find Parent
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I don't know ### Is this a regression? I don't know ### Description Using pieces of the full stackblitz below: Create a provider and a consumer component: ``` @Component({ selector: "app-provider", template: ``, providers: [TestService] }) export class ProviderComponent {} @Component({ selector: "app-consumer", template: `

Value: {{ testService.value }}

` }) export class ConsumerComponent { constructor(public testService: TestService) {} } ``` Create an indirection component: ``` @Component({ selector: "app-outer", template: `` }) export class OuterComponent {} ``` And app works they way you expect: ``` @Component({ selector: "my-app", template: ` ` }) export class AppComponent {} ``` But change the indirection component to be: ``` @Component({ selector: "app-outer", template: ` ` }) export class OuterComponent {} ``` and the app component to be ``` @Component({ selector: "my-app", template: ` ` }) export class AppComponent {} ``` and the provider can no longer be found even though the element structure remained the same. I would expect the level of component abstraction not to affect the ElementInjector hierarchy ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-10-base-template-cgkcmt ## üî• Exception or Error 

Error: R3InjectorError(AppModule)[TestService -> TestService -> TestService]:
NullInjectorError: No provider for TestService!
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

v10.0.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ElementInjector hierarchy fails to find Parent" (#39581)

Issues.Title: Ivy doesn't allow @Input() called "style" to be set from template using a static value
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, this behavior worked as expected under View Engine. ### Description Initializing an `@Input()` called `style` using a static value from a template doesn't work under Ivy. The provided value is never used to set the input. This bug could be causing silent failures because it almost never results in a runtime error and most tests don't directly test the input initialization. Relevant code snippets: Input definition: ```ts export class HelloComponent { @Input() style: string; ``` Input initialization: ```html ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ojvdl8?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.html ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

v11.0.0-rc.2 and older with Ivy enabled
## Additional info - There are several dozens 1P and 3P components that use the `style` name for inputs, but it's unclear how frequently they are being initialized using a static value. - At least one application google3 is broken due to this issue. - Inputs called `class` are not affected by this issue and work as expected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy doesn't allow @Input() called "style" to be set from template using a static value" (#39580)

Issues.Title: Clarification for documentation (Interceptors)
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description There is an example in documentation how to make AuthInterceptor. There's a step that helps to clone the request and replace the original headers with cloned headers, updated with the authorization. AuthToken was received with a help of AuthService. The method getAuthorizationToken() seems like never return null, even if there's no token yet. My own service returns null if user is not authorizated (there's no token in local storage). That's why I got a mistake: "Cannot read property 'length' of null". It was hard to find out the problem, so may be you can add a comment in documentation that authToken can't be null or just add null check? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/guide/http#setting-default-headers ## üî• Exception or Error 

core.js:4352 ERROR TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of null
    at HttpHeaders.applyUpdate (http.js:235)
    at http.js:207
    at Array.forEach ()
    at HttpHeaders.init (http.js:207)
    at HttpHeaders.forEach (http.js:270)
    at Observable._subscribe (http.js:1580)
    at Observable._trySubscribe (Observable.js:42)
    at Observable.subscribe (Observable.js:28)
    at innerSubscribe (innerSubscribe.js:67)
    at MergeMapSubscriber._innerSub (mergeMap.js:57)
### Anything else relevant? Maybe it's obvious, but not for me :) Thank you!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clarification for documentation (Interceptors)" (#39578)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): do not drop non-Angular decorators when downleveling
Issues.Body:
There is a compiler transform that downlevels Angular class decorators
to static properties so that metadata is available for JIT compilation.
The transform was supposed to ignore non-Angular decorators but it was
actually completely dropping decorators that did not conform to a very
specific syntactic shape (i.e. the decorator was a simple identifier, or
a namespaced identifier).

This commit ensures that all non-Angular decorators are kepts as-is
even if they are built using a syntax that the Angular compiler does not
understand.

Fixes #39574
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): do not drop non-Angular decorators when downleveling" (#39577)

Issue Number: #31546

In the current behavior Angular doesn't cleanup `popstate` and `hashchange` event listeners when the root view gets destroyed when calling `ngModuleRef.destroy()`. This entails duplicating event handlers every time the application is bootstrapped again.

Issues.Title: Support safe navigation operator when using string literal to access object properties in templates
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package N/A ### Is this a regression? N/A ### Description I am accessing an object property using string literal notation such as `{{user.info[propName]}}` where `propName` is filled automatically from a `*ngFor` directive. Sometimes, the `user` object does not have an `info` property filled in so I am trying to use the safe navigation operator as `{{user.info?[propName]}}` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-nrmgtw?file=src/app/app.component.html ## üî• Exception or Error 


Template parse errors:
Parser Error: Conditional expression user.info?[propName] requires all 3 expressions at the end of the expression [ {{user.info?[propName]}} ] in /~/src/app/app.component.html@6:4 ("

Issues.Title: Dynamic Component not insert into shadowDOM
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/10x ### Is this a regression? This was brought to our attention through https://github.com/ionic-team/ionic-framework/issues/22421 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/mhartington/ng-wc-component-factory-issue ## üî• Exception or Error No exception or error is thrown ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): Enable pipe information when checkTypeOfPipes‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶=false

When `checkTypeOfPipes` is set to `false`, the configuration is meant to
ignore the signature of the pipe's `transform` method for diagnostics.
However, we still should produce some information about the pipe for the
`TemplateTypeChecker`. This change refactors the returned symbol for
pipes so that it also includes information about the pipe's class
instance as it appears in the TCB.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): Enable pipe information when checkTypeOfPipes‚Ä¶" (#39555)

Issues.Title: WIP(compiler): disallow i18n of security-sensitive attributes
Issues.Body: ## PR Checklist Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements: - [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit - [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features) - [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features) ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [X] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes - [ ] CI related changes - [ ] Documentation content changes - [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes - [X] Other... Please describe: Security improvements. ## What is the current behavior? It is currently possible to mark security-sensitive attributes for i18n translation, e.g.: ``` ``` This is a feature that should have very little use, but at the same time introduces complexity and security risk in the i18n pipeline. ## What is the new behavior? The above template now generates a parsing error: ``` Error: src/app/app.component.html:69:35 - error NG5002: i18n translation of security-sensitive attributes is not supported. 69 ~~~~~~~~ ``` (The same error occurs when using `ng extract-i18n`.) ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [X] Yes - [ ] No This seems to be used extremely rarely. Sifting through GitHub search results for [i18n-src](https://github.com/search?q=i18n-src&type=Code) only reveals a [single result](https://github.com/IUNO-TDM/JuiceMarketplaceWebsite/blob/9028632b9aadd36413fdda0a2ac16477196aca83/JuiceMarketplaceWebsite-app/src/app/landingpage/start/start.component.html#L60) that might be affected by this change. (Note that e.g. `
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "WIP(compiler): disallow i18n of security-sensitive attributes" (#39554)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add validation to fileReplacement values
Issues.Body:
fileReplacement is meant to replace compilation source files (JavaScript or TypeScript) with other compilation source files in the build. With this change we add validation to fail the build when the files have unsupported extensions.

Closes #11451

Issues.Title: Option to specify schematics to install and run during new project creation
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

Ability to specify schematics to install and run during new project creation with `ng new`


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Use case example: I want to start a new project and have angular material, cdk, and ngrx installed and setup right after the project been bootstrapped.


### Describe the solution you'd like

```
ng new my-project --schematics=@angular/material,@angular/cdk,@ngrx/store
```

If the schematics have interactive setup scripts after installation, run the interactive installation scripts in the order defined in the `--schematics` option (the name for the options might not be appropriate, maybe pick a more explicit name for the option?)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Option to specify schematics to install and run during new project creation" (#19302)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): library generation on a solution-styled project
Issues.Body:
Solution Styled projects depends of `tsconfig.base.json`,  and when the new library paths has to be added, an unhandled exception is thrown (compilerOptions is not part of `tsconfig.json`)

this PR tries first to update `tsconfig.base.json`, and if it doesn't exists, fallback to the `tsconfig.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): library generation on a solution-styled project" (#19303)

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **TypeScript:** Older versions of `@types/node` will clash with this, because `@types/node` incorrectly defined `Symbol.observable` has `symbol` and not `unique symbol`. Update to `@types/node@14.14.6` or higher.

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/compare/v26.6.1...v26.6.2)

##### Features

-   `[jest-core]` Add `findRelatedTests` and `nonFlagArgs` in allowed config options for `updateConfigAndRun` in watch plugins ([#​10659](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10659))

##### Fixes

-   `[babel-plugin-jest-hoist]` Preserve order of hoisted mock nodes within containing block ([#​10536](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10536))
-   `[babel-plugin-jest-hoist]` Hoist pure constants to support experimental JSX transform in hoisted mocks ([#​10723](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10723))
-   `[babel-preset-jest]` Update `babel-preset-current-node-syntax` to support top level await ([#​10747](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10747))
-   `[expect]` Revert "Fix `objectContaining` to work recursively into sub-objects ([#​10508](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10508))" ([#​10766](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10766))
-   `[jest-circus, jest-jasmine2]` fix: don't assume `stack` is always a string ([#​10697](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10697))
-   `[jest-config]` Fix bug introduced in watch mode by PR [#​10678](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10678/files#r511037803) ([#​10692](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10692))
-   `[jest-config]` Throw correct error for missing preset modules ([#​10737](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10737))
-   `[jest-resolve-dependencies]` Resolve mocks as dependencies ([#​10713](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10713))
-   `[jest-runtime]` Handle file URLs in dynamic imports ([#​10744](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10744))
-   `[jest-runtime, babel-jest]` Pass more ESM options to `@jest/transform` ([#​10752](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10752))
-   `[jest-runtime]` Properly inject `extraGlobals` into the runtime ([#​10758](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10758))
-   `[jest-transform]` Link to ESM docs on syntax errors ([#​10748](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10748))

##### Chore & Maintenance

-   `[docs]` Add docs for using mocks in TypeScript ([#​10415](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10415))
-   `[eslint-config-fb-strict]` Move package from this repo to `fbjs` repo ([#​10739](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10739))
-   `[examples]` Update TypeScript example to show use of newer Jest types ([#​10399](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10399))
-   `[jest-cli]` chore: standardize files and folder names ([#​10698](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/10698))

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove `sourceMappingURL` from vendor modules
Issues.Body:
With this change we add a loader that removes the `//# sourceMappingURL=` comment from `.js` files.
Webpack will not remove these comments when the chunk that these mules are in, are excluded from `SourceMapDevToolPlugin`.

Closes #19236

Issues.Title: fix(material/checkbox): set display on host node
Issues.Body:
Currently the host nodes are `display: inline` by default which doesn't allow for things like `margin` and `width` to be set. These changes switch to `inline-block` which is a bit more flexible.

Fixes #20954.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/checkbox): set display on host node" (#20961)

Issues.Title: MatCheckbox should be `display: inline-block`
Issues.Body: Currently `<mat-checkbox>` is `display: inline`. This means that things like margin, height, width, etc. won't apply to it. The element should be `display: inline-block`. The MDC version also has this problem. We may decide to only fix this in the MDC version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "MatCheckbox should be `display: inline-block`" (#20954)

Issues.Title: refactor(google-maps): simplify marker internal setup
Issues.Body:
Currently the various Google Maps sub-components are set up so that each input has a setter, a `BehaviorSubject` and a method to watch it for changes. This doesn't scale very well on components with lots of inputs so these changes use an alternate one where we synchronously update the marker state whenever an input changes.

**Note:** This PR is meant to be a proof-of-concept so that we can discuss the approach. If we agree that it's the way forward, it can be applied to the other map components.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(google-maps): simplify marker internal setup" (#20975)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): scrolling on mobile blocked for disabled drag handle
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
A cdkDropList (any kind of drag-drop-countainer would most likely have this issue as well) with disabled cdkDrag items which have a drag handle inside.
https://angular-st9rbb.stackblitz.io/
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-st9rbb?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-drag-drop-disabled-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Switch browser to mobile view / use touchscreen
2. Try to scroll by first touching the drag handle and moving up/down
  
#### Expected Behavior
Scrolling (with a touch screen) is possible, even on the drag handle if the cdkDrag item is disabled.

#### Actual Behavior
Scrolling is impossible, because the drag handle blocks scrolling, even if it is disabled:
![cdk-drag-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22572128/98251118-99b14400-1f78-11eb-8d1c-0299128eb798.gif)

#### Environment

- CDK/Material: 10.0.0 (also tested with latest 10.2.7 and issue persists)
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox, iOS Safari, Android Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, iOS, Android
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): scrolling on mobile blocked for disabled drag handle" (#20974)

Issues.Title: bug(dialog): dialog's content text color is not secondary-text
Issues.Body:
#### Description

When looking at the Material Design page of Dialogs (https://material.io/components/dialogs#anatomy) one can see that the Dialog's content text (in the Anatomy example this is labeled as *Supporting text*) is displayed in a lighter gray than the title.

#### Reproduction

Repository: https://github.com/c-kunz/mat-dialog-content-secondary-text

Steps to reproduce:
1. `git clone https://github.com/c-kunz/mat-dialog-content-secondary-text repro`
2. `cd repro`
3. `npm i`
4. `ng serve -o`
 
#### Expected Behavior

I would expect the dialog's content to be in a lighter gray than the title. When looking at the Angular Material Theme Color Configuration I would expect this to be:

`theme-or-color-config: foreground: secondary-text`.

#### Actual Behavior

The dialog's content text color is the same as the title's color (`rgba(0,0,0, 0.87)`).

#### Workaround attempt

I've tried to find a fitting CSS class as described in here, but with no luck: https://material.angular.io/guide/typography#material-typography-in-your-custom-css

I've tried to do the following:

```scss
$theme: ...
.my-theme {
    @include angular-material-theme($theme);

    .mat-dialog-content {
        color: map-get(map-get($theme, foreground), secondary-text);
    }
}
```

But this causes every text to be displayed in that `secondary-text`, even in `mat-form-fields` where I want the darker variant so it can be read better.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.2.2
- CDK/Material: 10.2.7
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(dialog): dialog's content text color is not secondary-text" (#20973)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/a11y): allow for origin of already focused element to be changed
Issues.Body:
The way `FocusMonitor.focusVia` works is by calling `focus` on the specified element and waiting for a `focus` event to trigger so the origin is applied. The problem is that if `focusVia` is called on an element that already has focus, the event won't be dispatched and the origin won't be updated which can cause the UI to look stuck.

These changes make it so that if we detect that an element is focused already, we update its classes and dispatch the relevant event without trying to focus it.

Related to #20965.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/a11y): allow for origin of already focused element to be changed" (#20966)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-slide-toggle): hide native focus outline
Issues.Body:
Hides the native focus outline from the slide toggle since we use the ripple for focus indication.

This is what it currently looks like for reference. This only happens for a split second when clicking on the label.

![nO5nhvD](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/98039296-c6e9df00-1e1e-11eb-8f7c-b10ce5f3a84a.png)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-progress-spinner): prevent animation from affecting surrounding layout

The issue can be seen on Windows where the scroll bar is always visible.

Issues.Body: Adds a new script that checks whether an MDC package exports the same set of symbols as its non-MDC counterpart. Also fixes all of the failures.

Issues.Title: bug(menu): matMenuTrigger not exposing menuOpen properly
Issues.Body: #### Reproduction Issue not reproducible on Stackblitz. Therefore, I opted to create this repo: https://github.com/MatLang/menuDemo. The repository contains a simple menu in a component that has its changeDetection set to OnPush. ```html ``` Steps to reproduce: 1. Clone the above repo 2. Serve the application 3. Open/Close the menu #### Expected Behavior I am expecting "up" and "down" to show up alternatively, depending on if the menu is closed or not. #### Actual Behavior The behavior is inconsistent, i.e. showing "up" and "down" in different states. #### Possible Fix Follow a more reactive approach and expose the menuState as a stream. #### Environment - Angular: ~10.2.0 - CDK/Material: ^10.2.7 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(menu): matMenuTrigger not exposing menuOpen properly" (#20959)
